children.text: The balustrade in this area has been constructed so it is climbable, and the possible fall is greater than 4m.
Part 3.9.2.3 Balustrades or other Barrier Construction of the Building Code of Australia (BCA) requires that

‘Where it is possible to fall more than 4m, any horizontal elements within the barrier between 150mm and 760mm above the floor must not facilitate climbing (the 4m is measured from the floor level of the trafficable surface to the surface beneath)’ .
This balustrade must be immediately rectified so that it is installed in accordance with the requirements of the BCA.
